author: matiaswepfer
title: real estate sector lacks a DEFI
description: The real estate sector lacks a DEFI solution.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem and solution to the problem are presented in a vague manner and seems that the proposer lacks in understanding concepts like DAO (Decentralized Autonomous Organisation) and DeFi (Decentralized Finance).
It is unclear what would be the benefits for the Cardano ecosystem and its community members.
f6_assessments.q1:
No team members are presented (even there is a brief statement about "our team of professionals") and is unclear who would take care of the developing stages of this project.

The budget is broken down into two identifiable items and is highly overvalued based on the output of the amount requested. Also the proposer seems to not fully understand what "tokenomics" means ($20k are necessary to do what precisely?)

he proposal doesn't offer a realistic timetable to complete the work and doesn't provide a conductible plan for implementation
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal looks more like an abstract concept than a working project as it lacks in providing relevant information about what is to be done, how and by whom.
No relevant metrics are defined.
There is nothing to assess at this proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal has identified a problem within the challenge. Unfortunately the proposal lacks crucial information that could help its rate on its impact on the cardano network. I suggest to the proposer to look at funded proposals as reference in order to better structure this proposal. The problem identified may fit into the challenge. However there is a serious need for improvements to  this project, for instance, by articulating how it adds value to the cardano ecosystem, adding key metrics and strong KPIs and all the other details that can be useful to the proposal.
.
f6_assessments.q1: There is not enough information in this proposal to be feasible. The proposer should've add evidence of relevance skills and experiences, as well as the team and resources needed to complete the project. The proposer can extend the proposal improvement by adding a budget breakdown section, a timetable to complete the work, a clear description of what is being built and how.  Once all these areas are filled, I think that the proposal can have a chance of being approved in future funds.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal lacks the basic information required to be auditable. The proposer should add a roadmap with realistic milestones , Metrics and KPIs and a clear description of the product being built and the problem it solves. The best way, in my opinion, to get help for structuring the proposal is to head over the funded proposal and emulate them.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal seems like a means to fund to inception and idea of a project that would bring value to cardano DeFi. If this team can provide a whitepaper and info on the exact team to be hired and working on the project then it would be ready to put up for vote to receive funding.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal seems in the very early stage of inception and does not have a roadmap or project plan yet. The proposal does not provide sufficient information to gague what the team wants to do and if they are accomplishing that. We would just be funding them to be able to come up with an idea.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal does provide some information on where money would go and what their goals are, but this proposal is in the very early stages of inception so the only thing to gague would be if they came up with a whitepaper and if they spent money to hire someone to begin working on the idea.

f6_assessments.q0: Project to "Create a DAO project to provide loans and financial solutions to the real estate sector." and "The first market USA and other markets such as LATAM" (I believe LATAM  is Latin America? Since not provide abbreviated for). If the project can address "loans and financial solutions" effectively and legally, ground play for real estate investors and Cardano ADA holders. Thus, the use case outcome for this project would be magnificent.
f6_assessments.q1:
With a total request fund of US$50,000 and pay for US$20,000 for a pre-estimated internal Tokenomics specialist and US$30,000 will pay Realtok and Tec to write a white paper for this project. There is no information or any links on both teams. No info on the components or even the table of content of the to-be-form Whitepaper, which is worth $30,000 is provided. And the most important for the DiFi project is risk analysis because, without risk analysis, the investor or the end-user would be reluctant to use the platform. I provide two quick links below that might help you rewrite and do more research and comprise data for next month if you wish to carry on with your journey.
(Short version) https://t.me/ProjectCatalystChat/60411 or (extended version) https://cardanocataly.st/en/proposers/
f6_assessments.q2: With a $50,000 project requested, there is no information on how Tokenomics specialist and Realtok and Tec could be carried out. It is genuinely impossible for the community to view the challenge team monitoring and reporting your project progress. Should you refer to the two links provided in the feasibility box if you ever wish to rewrite and resubmit in the future fund rounds.

solution: Create a DAO project to provide loans and financial solutions to the real estate sector.
experience: Realtok DAO is already developing a marketplace for real estate and art projects and needs a DAO that integrates a DEFI solution.
